newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Blair to stage "Talk to Tony" shows.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Blair to stage "Talk to Tony" shows.

text.p: Britain's new Labour Prime Minister Tony Blair will stage regular question-and-answer sessions with members of the public, a government spokesman said on Saturday.
The first of the monthly 90-minute appearances will take place next Friday, when people in the English Midlands will have the chance to question Blair about law and order and juvenile crime.
The spokesman said the televised "Talk to Tony" sessions were intended to keep Blair in touch with what people were thinking and stop him developing a "bunker mentality".

Blair has already come under fire for changing the way in which he can be questioned in the House of Commons and critics attacked the new public sessions as a means of avoiding expert questions from members of parliament and journalists.
But Blair has said that some of the toughest questions he faced during the election campaign came from members of the public.
Each of the planned sessions will revolve round a particular issue, although questioners will be able to bring up other matters.
